description: Application to confirm commencement of development prior to expiry date pursuant to Condition 1 of planning permission ref: 72115/APP/2020/2688 dated 24-02-2021 (Creation of first floor level and change of use of existing offices to create 2 x 2-bed and 3 x 1-bed self contained flats, parking and cycle storage involving alterations to elevations and associated works) (Application for Certificate of Lawfulness for an Existing Operation)
decision_conditions: It is hereby certified that the operations described in the 'Description of development' hereto in respect of the land specified in the 'Location of development' hereto and edged in red on the Location Plan (drawing number 40) attached to this certificate, would have been lawful within the meaning of Section 191 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended), for the following reason:

The works carried out at the application site prior to 24th February 2024 commenced the development authorised by planning permission 72115/APP/2020/2688, such that this permission remains extant. Completion of the authorised development in accordance with the terms and conditions of planning permission 72115/APP/2020/2688, would therefore be covered by an express grant of planning permission and so would be lawful.

Under the terms of the Planning Act 2008 (as amended) and Community Infrastructure Levy Regulations 2010 (as amended), the development approved under planning permission 72115/APP/2020/2688 is liable to pay the London Borough of Hillingdon Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL) and the Mayor of London's Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL). This will be calculated in accordance with the London Borough of Hillingdon CIL Charging Schedule 2014 and the Mayor of London's CIL Charging Schedule 2012.

The development parties must assume liability to pay CIL (by submitting an Assumption of Liability Notice) to the Council at planning@hillingdon.gov.uk. The Council will then issue a Demand Notice setting out the date and the amount of CIL that is payable. Failure to submit a valid Assumption of Liability Notice and Commencement Notice prior to commencement of the development may result in surcharges being imposed.
The above forms can be found on the planning portal at: www.planningportal.gov.u
